citeinfo.origin:
Nicholas Bond
University of Washington (UW), Joint Institute for the Study of Atmosphere and Ocean (JISAO)
citeinfo.title: Eastern Equatorial Pacific Rawinsonde Data

descript.abstract: Weather balloon soundings have been collected since the mid-1990's from NOAA ships during TAO mooring cruises. Sets of soundings are available at 6 month intervals, with some substantial gaps, mostly along the 110 W and 95 W lines.
descript.purpose: This data set has been collected to document the atmospheric structure in the cold tongue/ITCZ complex, and its relationship to short-term climate variations.

idinfo.accconst: Acknowledgement of data source publication required.
